Subject: TTT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=7192225; y=VM0R-o54NfyHJ6FT3GL9AuKKQgrN1Wz19F7j7IGBmeZqv7pmUQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: ian_badcoe

Hi,
	In case it is useful to anybody, I uploaded a text file with a complete 
analysis of TTT using normalisation to reduce the number of boards to a 
reasonable number.

	The top part (about 2/3 of the file) where it is all nested and tabbed, is 
a tree of every possible game starting with who's to play and whether 
anybody has won, then listing every possible and either (i) the board it 
creates or (ii) a link to which already-considered board would be created.

	The bottom part is just a flat listing of every board, who's to play, 
who's won, what other boards are reached from here, and who's going to win 
given perfect play.

	Ian

In fifteen minutes, everybody will be in the future.
